content: however the pattern is my property and cannot be sold copied or shared partially or totally when posting your work please reference my pattern thank you for your support and care of all the work that goes behind each pattern the chart a chart is included with a photo at the beginning of the pattern table for those who prefer to crochet from a picture also it is good to compare to make sure it is looking as it should the pattern the table with the pattern has grey row for all a row hopefully it is easier to read when you are working on even numbered row you are working with the back of the sample facing you it may help to know that when working on even row you are following the drawing from left to right when you are working on odd numbered row you are working with the front of the sample facing you when working on odd row you are following the drawing from right to left all row should start with ch3 and at the beginning of each row pay attention to where the b colour should hang either to the front or the back as this will affect the drawing/pattern this is marked in the second column of the pattern also at the end of all b row the very last stitch is not followed by a chain 1 the border the border as the rest of the sample is done one in each colour first colour b then a with colour b on colour b windows start with 1sc in the first window then 2sc in every window 5sc in each corner when you reach the last corner make 3sc cut your yarn and join to first single_crochet with invisible join that makes the last of 5 stitches in that corner window with colour a on colour a windows start with 1hdc in the first window continue all around with 2 half_double_crochet in every window the first three corners 2hdc 1hdc grabbing the middle 3rd single_crochet of the colour b window 2 half_double_crochet when you reach the end of the round 2hdc in the last window 1hdc grabbing the middle single_crochet of the colour b window cut your yarn and join with invisible join that makes the last of 5 stitches in that corner window if you want a potholder loop with colour b make border as above with colour a on colour a windows start with chain 25 for your loop and slip_stitch into the same corner window make 2 half_double_crochet in the first window continue all around with 2 half_double_crochet in every window the first three corners 2hdc 1hdc grabbing the middle 3rd single_crochet of the colour b window 2 half_double_crochet when you reach the end of the round 2hdc in the last window and 25 single_crochet on the 25 chains of the loop join to the first half_double_crochet with an invisible join and cut a bit longer than usual
